summary: States collect data on Medicaid services to help the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) oversee the managed care program. For example, this data can help set managed care payment rates, identify inappropriate billing patterns, and ensure access to services. But what if the data isn’t reliable? CMS started requiring states to have independent audits of their data to help ensure reliability, but hasn't...
title: Medicaid Managed Care: Additional CMS Actions Needed to Help Ensure Data Reliability
